lead_paragraph: Fans of Burgundy wines have two events to choose from on Friday. The first is a six-course dinner featuring Burgundy wines, bourbons and game to benefit the Days of Taste program of the American Institute of Wine and Food, which works to improve children's food, at 6:30 p.m. at Beacon, 25 West 56th Street (Avenue of the Americas). Tickets are $100 for members of the institute and $125 for the general public. For a taste of nearly a dozen different wines from the Burgundy region, sign up for a 7 p.m. tasting class at the Institute of Culinary Education, 50 West 23rd Street (between Fifth and Sixth Avenues), in Chelsea, (212) 847-0700. Bernard Sun, corporate beverage director of the Jean-Georges Vongerichten's restaurants, leads the class, which is $90 per person.
